author: Nirnimesh Kumar
text:
Allowing a plea by BJP leader Subramanian Swamy, a Delhi court on Friday summoned balance sheets of the Indian National Congress and the Associated Journals Private Limited (AJL) in The National Herald case of cheating and misappropriation.

AJL is the publisher of the now defunct daily, The National Herald .

Summoning their balance sheets for 2010-2011, Metropolitan magistrate Loveleen said they could not be referred as the “personal documents” of the accused persons.

Congress president Sonia Gandhi, vice-president Rahul Gandhi and four others are facing prosecution in the case on a complaint by Dr. Swamy. All the accused in the case are on bail.

The court had on Wednesday reserved the order.

Dr. Swamy had sought summoning of the balance sheets, receipts, income and expenditure statements for the assessment years 2010-11, 2011-12 and 2012-13 of the party, the AJL and the Young Indian Limited (YIL).

However, he later did not press for the YIL’s documents.

“One of the causes for summoning the accused is that they advanced an interest-free loan to AJL to the tune of approximately Rs. 90 crore from the funds of the Congress and thereby defrauded the donors of the Congress as well as the state exchequer by claiming tax exemptions,” the court said in its three-page order.

“It is directed that the balance sheets of the INC and the AJL pertaining to the year 2010-2011 be summoned on filing of process fee for the next date of hearing [March 21],” the magistrate said.

Sonia, Rahul and four others are facing prosecution in The National Herald case
title: Court asks for Cong., AJL balance sheets
